results.title: The Greatest adventures of Popeye
results.brief_description: A compilation of three full length animated cartoons nominated for an Academy Award. These action filled cartoons see the famous spinach eater with Olive Oyl, Wimpy and Brutus and are entertaining for all the family. Following the exciting animations is a bonus sing-a-long complete with bouncing ball to the theme song “Popeye the Sailor Man”.

results.title: The Greater community animal
results.brief_description: An animated film which examines why the individual has to have his idiosyncrasies and his potentialities processed out of existence in order to be made acceptable to society. Considers individualism, conformism and the compromises which have to be made. American Film Festival Blue Ribbon.

results.title: The Great zoos of the world, Frankfurt
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Scene”.
A tour of the Frankfurt Zoo, showing the influence Dr Bernhard Grzimek, the Director, has had on the kind of animals in the collection and they way in which they are displayed. Also looks at the question of having one man in sole charge of a zoo.

results.title: The Great whales
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society and Nicolas Noxon
results.brief_description: Once feared and hunted, the whale has become a fascinating subject for study. Whale anatomy, communication and migration patterns are discussed in this revealing look at the largest animal on earth.
results.description: Once feared and hunted, the whale has become a fascinating subject for study. Whale anatomy, communication and migration patterns are discussed in this revealing look at the largest animal on earth.

results.title: The Great War
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Frank Bagnall and Alan Anderson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “War Experience”.
Uses contemporary film records of the Australian forces in the 1914-18 War to illustrate the conditions in which they served and the effects on survivors.

results.title: The Great Waltz
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Bernard H. Hyman and Julien Duvivier
results.brief_description: This film captures the spirit of a romantic age when Johann Strauss created some of the world’s favourite melodies. French actor Fernand Gravet plays Strauss with Luise Rainer as his wife Poldi. Soprano Miliza Korjus plays Carla Donner, the opera singer with whom Strauss was infatuated and for whom he wrote some of his greatest works including “Die Fledermaus”

results.title: The Great treasure house
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Mans China”.
Covers the theme of medicine in China. Shows traditional medicine, including acupuncture and herbalism. Since the Cultural Revolution many remarkable new applications for the ancient art of acupuncture have been discovered, and some of these are shown. We also see ‘barefoot doctors’, trained in simple medicine, working in minor illnesses in small villages. With the help of modern techniques being developed, alongside ancient and traditional medicine, the Chinese are among the healthiest people in the world today.

results.title: The Great Train Robbery
results.brief_description: Edwin Stanton Porter (April 21, 1870 – April 30, 1941) was an American film pioneer, most famous as a producer, director, studio manager and cinematographer with the Edison Manufacturing Company and the Famous Players Film Company. Of over 250 films created by Porter, his most important include Jack and the Beanstalk (1902), Life of an American Fireman (1903), The Great Train Robbery (1903), The Kleptomaniac (1905), Life of a Cowboy (1906), Rescued from an Eagle’s Nest (1908), and The Prisoner of Zenda (1913) .
results.description: Edwin Stanton Porter (April 21, 1870 – April 30, 1941) was an American film pioneer, most famous as a producer, director, studio manager and cinematographer with the Edison Manufacturing Company and the Famous Players Film Company. results.title: The Great toy robbery
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall, Wolf Koenig, Tom Daly and Jeffrey Hale
results.brief_description: An animated spoof of the wild west movies starring the world’s most wanted good guy, Santa Claus, and three hard riding, gun-toting, bad guys. As in all formula westerns, good guys win over evil, but not before robbers and robbed have romped through some incongruous, though recognizable situations. (Awards include: New York, Belgrade)
